div.div: ἀμφ-αφάω , part. ἀμφαφόων, -όωσα, mid. inf. -άασθαι, ipf. -όωντο: feel about, handle, esp. to test or examine something; τρὶς δὲ περίστειξας κοῖλον λόχον ἀμφαφόωσα (Helen walks around the Trojan horse and ‘feels over’ it, while the Greeks are concealed within), Od. 4.277; of examining a necklace, χερσίν τ᾽ ἀμφαφόωντο, Od. 15.462.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
